multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: commodities; Russia's new Power of Siberia 2 pipeline to China will increase gas supply to China, potentially easing European supply constraints and influencing global gas price dynamics, with a catalyst window around the 2024 signing and expected 2025-2027 start of deliveries.

category.motivation: Gazprom signed a binding agreement to build the Power of Siberia 2 pipeline to China, which is a company-level action (not earnings), fitting the company_update category.

time_frame.motivation: The article reports a binding agreement for a 30‑year gas pipeline that will alter long‑term supply dynamics between Russia and China, representing a structural, fundamental shift.

article_node.title: Russia and China Sign Major Deal for New Gas Pipeline
article_node.summary: Russia’s Gazprom has signed a binding agreement to build the Power of Siberia 2 gas pipeline to China via Mongolia, potentially delivering up to 50 billion cubic metres a year for 30 years at a lower price than Europe. The deal is seen as a political win for Putin and a sign of deepening Russia‑China ties amid Western sanctions, but key details such as construction dates, pricing and flexible volume terms remain unclear.
